But as 3s have become so prevalent in recent years, fans are criticizing the league for being oversaturated with them.

Statistic-obsessed sports executive Daryl Morey used the D-league Rio Grande Valley Vipers as a testing ground to see if volume shooting 3s netted better results than shooting 2s.

And it worked. https://t.co/Am2Dsjnpgb

The math says scoring a third of your shots from behind the 3-point line is as good as scoring half of your shots from within. 

In other words: shooting as many 3s as possible will likely lead to a higher score. https://t.co/Am2Dsjnpgb

During the 1999 @NBA playoffs, @orlandomagic attempted only 29% of their overall shots behind the 3-point line, the most of any team for that playoff season.

Synthetic fibers come off in the wash and pass through to sewage treatment plants. Treated wastewater is then  often dumped into rivers or the sea.

Here is how many of these fibers could be shed in the wash. #WorldOceansDay https://t.co/sKKNqSRkEb

Worldwide, there are robust efforts to reduce plastic use.

As we seek solutions to the overall issue of plastic pollution, we need to recognize that our clothing is a major part of the problem and will need to be part of the solution as well. Learn more: https://t.co/2VaHTsZTNh

Polyester, nylon, acrylic, and other synthetic fibers are all forms of plastic.

They can eventually reach the ocean, adding to the microplastic pollution that's accumulating in the food chain and being ingested by marine wildlife, and even us. https://t.co/2VaHTsZTNh

Today is World Oceans Day ‚Äî and 60% of all clothing worldwide is made from plastic. They leach into the environment just by being washed.

Estimates vary, but it's possible that a single laundry load could release hundreds of thousands of plastic fibers into the water supply. https://t.co/NqODKk8jo2

Amazon fired Chris Smalls. Now the new union leader is one of its biggest problems. https://t.co/KRgfXNOxwj

However, the ALU faces significant challenges. If it doesn‚Äôt successfully pressure Amazon to deliver on some of the ambitious demands it campaigned on, it could lose the momentum it took a year to build.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve got 10,000 people‚Äôs lives in our hands.‚Äù https://t.co/DWwqLulDpF

Just days after the second union vote, Smalls testified before Congress about Amazon‚Äôs union-busting tactics.

His performance in DC revealed how, despite having no formal media training or background, he has captured the entire country‚Äôs attention. https://t.co/DWwqLulDpF

If the ALU can win more warehouses, it could propel a growing class of workers who are forming unions ‚Äî not just at Amazon, but at other major employers like Starbucks, Apple, and Dollar General ‚Äî to demand a better quality of life from their employers. https://t.co/DWwqLulDpF

To do that, @Shut_downAmazon and the ALU will need more support ‚Äî politically, financially, and logistically ‚Äî to face the uphill battle to unionize Amazon. 

The stakes are incredibly high. https://t.co/DWwqLulDpF

Amazon workers at about 100 Amazon warehouses in the US have contacted the ALU asking how they can start their own union campaigns, and Smalls wants to be the one to lead them. https://t.co/DWwqLulDpF https://t.co/Xo1wcuRxQl

A few days later, the ALU lost its second vote at Amazon‚Äôs Staten Island LDJ5 warehouse ‚Äî in large part, @Shut_downAmazon said, due to Amazon‚Äôs ramped-up anti-union campaigning. 

It hasn‚Äôt minimized Smalls‚Äôs or the ALU‚Äôs ambitions. https://t.co/DWwqLulDpF
